question: Tell me about Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts.
answer: The Board delegates authority for day-to-day management of the Company and its operations, including those related to climate matters, to the Executive Leadership Team (ELT). The Board and its committees regularly receive updates from management regarding the effectiveness of policies and procedures, progress regarding targets, risks and opportunities, global compliance standards, regulatory developments, disclosure standards, and other priority climate-related topics. The Chief Sustainability Officer (CSO) reports to the Executive Vice President (EVP) and President U.S., who is a member of the ELT [Source: data/AI Enginner Use Case Document.pdf | Page 8].

question: Please provide some information regarding Anti-Human Trafficking Work.
answer:
UPS plays an important role in the fight against human trafficking due to its reliance on transportation systems. The company mobilizes its workforce to act as the eyes and ears for victims and to provide information to law enforcement. In 2024, UPS partnered with Truckers Against Trafficking to provide anti-human trafficking training to newly hired drivers. Over 12,000 UPS drivers have completed this training, with the following outcomes:

- 95% of participants intend to use the skills and knowledge gained from the training.
- 93% would recommend this training to others.
- 90% feel they could identify a human trafficking situation based on the training.
- 97% feel they understand the process for reporting suspected human trafficking [Source: data/AI Enginner Use Case Document.pdf | Page 19].

question: now tell me about Renewable Electricity in UPS
answer:
UPS has set a goal to achieve 25% renewable electricity by 2025. As of 2024, 15.2% of their total electricity for owned and leased facilities was generated from renewable sources, an increase from 10.9% in 2023 [Source: data/AI Enginner Use Case Document.pdf | Page 27]. 

In 2024, UPS entered into a renewable electricity agreement to provide wind power from the Sweetwater 1 Wind Farm in Texas, supplying 98,095 MWh of renewable electricity per year to their Texas facilities [Source: data/AI Enginner Use Case Document.pdf | Page 27]. Additionally, they completed a pilot microgrid project in Visalia, California, featuring a rooftop solar system of 2.49 MW and a battery system of 4.3 MWh for backup [Source: data/AI Enginner Use Case Document.pdf | Page 27].

UPS's U.S. data centers procured 100% renewable energy in 2024 through unbundled renewable energy credits (RECs), marking the third consecutive year of such purchases [Source: data/AI Enginner Use Case Document.pdf | Page 27]. The RECs purchased complied with specific procurement policies including being Green-e Certified and produced within the calendar year [Source: data/AI Enginner Use Case Document.pdf | Page 27].

Furthermore, UPS aims for a goal of 100% renewable electricity by 2035 and has entered into long-term contracts for new solar facilities in Colorado and participation in the New York Community Solar program [Source: data/AI Enginner Use Case Document.pdf | Page 27].
